title: Sri Lanka cabinet ministers give resignations to PM: Dinesh
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers had given resignations to Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa to take action as needed, Education Minister Dinesh Gunewardena said as the country reels from an forex shortages created by money printed to keep interest rates low.
“We discussed the situation in the country,” Gunewardena said. “We discussed the problems of the people.
“We gave resignations to the Prime Minister saying we are willing to leave at any time. After discussing with the President the steps to be taken will be decided.”
Sri Lanka’s Prime Minister’s office earlier denied reports that he was to step down.
Sri Lanka has hit an economic crisis after printing money for two years to create a production economy after cutting taxes and nation wide peaceful protests took place on Sunday.
The resignations come amid calls to form an interim government by sections of the ruling coalition.
Sri Lanka Freedom Party had earlier said it would make a decision on whether the resign their portfolios on April 04.
